unit_learning_outcomes.description: utilise and apply writing techniques of a high standard.
evaluate the complexity of ethical issues in the field, and treat information in an ethical manner.
critically analyse and synthesise a variety of readings chosen as instructive on the craft of writing and use these to reflect on students' own writing.
research, write and edit stories of a high standard that fall into the broad category of life writing.
identify, analyse and critique key issues raised in the production of life writing.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Writing tasks and preparation for discussions

assessments.description: For this assessment students can submit a memoir piece, personal essay, or travel writing. In addition to the written essay, they have the option to submit a podcast or a video (with the written text provided). Refer to iLearn for further information.
For this assessment students are required to submit a memoir article. Refer to iLearn for further information.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
data.subject_search_title: MMCC3011 - Writing for Love or Money

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: Students in this unit will concentrate on the craft of life-writing, from memoir to travel writing, personal essays and writing that plays at the border between fact and fiction. The emphasis will be on refining storytelling techniques while examining the way the different elements of a story come together to convey the subjectivity of the writer and stir responses in the reader.
data.search_title: MMCC3011 - Writing for Love or Money

title: Writing for Love or Money
